Introduction
In order to ease and automate Linux installations, &company-suse; offers AutoYaST2. AutoYaST2 lets the user create a configuration for a system to be installed and automatically performs the installation if the configuration is provided to &yast2; during installation.
&IntroductionLinuxJournal;
Using AutoYaST2, multiple systems sharing the same environment and hardware performing similar tasks can easily be installed in parallel. A configuration file (referred to as "control file") is created using existing configuration resources and it can be easily tailored for any specific settings. Auto-Installation is interesting when installing large number of machines which at least have one thing in common. For example auto-installation can be used for installing a network of workstations which share the same environment and have similar hardware and will be performing similar tasks.
